page.title: 11SAMBOURNE BUILDINGS
page.content:
The Green Dragon pub has parts which are 17th century and it may have been a pub ever since then. Before, it was a carters' inn where the drivers met before driving through the dangerous Feckenham forest. The market used to be held behind the pub.
There is an ancient railway line which used to be a vital link line. Sambourne has a lot of features including a trout farm, monks baths and its own village shop. Most of the buildings in Sambourne are very old. One next to the pub is especially old. It has all of its old beams still intact. In the middle of the village green there is a tree which was planted to commemorate Edward VII, although the first tree died.
